text:
What's up everybody we're the Vagabrothers
and these are our Top Ten Things to do in
Helsinki, Finland.

Finland's stylish capital is compact, cool
and a lot of fun and these are our tips on
making the most of your visit.

Number one the Olympic stadium - Climbing
up the tower in the Olympic Stadium is not

only a great way to get your bearings in the
city, it also tells an interesting story.

Helsinki was supposed to host the 1940 Olympics
but the Second World War broke out and the
stadium never got to see an Olympian.

Number two Suomenlinna - A short ferry ride
from downtown is the island sea fortress of Suomenlinna,

a UNESCO world heritage site complete with
a functioning village, a high school and even
a microbrewery.

Number three the Design district - Finland
is known for it's design which is austere

yet functional and the coolest place to check
out the latest trends is the Design District

in downtown where you'll find boutiques selling
everything from fashionable clothes to home
decor.

Number four The Old Market - The recently
renovated Old Market is the best place to

get a grip on Finnish food culture, which
focuses on high quality local ingredients.

All of which you can try or buy from the many
different vendors.

Number five Cafe Culture - Finns are some
of the biggest coffee drinkers in the world,

so make sure you check out what's brewing
at local landmarks like Cafe Regatta or new

startups like Cafe Kokko, which also happens
to serve excellent vegan cakes.

Number six Baltic Beaches - Helsinki is connected
to Europe through the Baltic Sea, which is

surprisingly warm in summer. Work on your
tan at one of Helsinki's many popular beaches
or explore the coast on a Stand Up Paddle.

Number seven Kallio Pub Crawl - Kallio is
a former industrial neighborhood that is now

hipster-central and is also home to some of
the best bars in Helsinki, which you can link
up on a pub crawl.

Number eight Temple of Silence - After a night
at the bars, your head will probably be ringing.

Regain your calm at the newly built temple
of silence, an architectural masterpiece that

contains a small chapel that is - you guessed
it - really really quiet.

Number nine Get into Nature - the best place
to find peace and quiet is in nature, and

Helsinki is surrounded by wilderness. So head
over to nearby Nuksio National Park, and check
out its forests, lakes, and pretty good fishing.
Number ten a Sauna - Last but not least, spend some time in a sauna.
There are more saunas than people in Finland and your hotel is guaranteed to have one.
So strip off those clothes and enjoy Finland's best invention ever.
Bye Bye!

Those are our recommendations for Helsinki,
Finland, what are yours? Let us know in the
comment box below and if you haven't seen our vlog from Helsinki you should check that out

As always, if you enjoyed the video give it
a thumbs up, share it with your friends on

social media and don't forget to subscribe
to our channel for more travel videos every
week.
See you guys later!
Peace!
